body_html:
I grepped the logs and there are some suspicious architecture-related warnings:

$ grep "library machine type" 5ea42dd3-build.log  | head
    41>zlib\install\lib\zlibstatic.lib : warning LNK4272: library machine type 'X86' conflicts with target machine type 'x64' [T:\src\github\tensorflow\cmake_build\proto_text.vcxproj]
    41>gif\install\lib\giflib.lib : warning LNK4272: library machine type 'X86' conflicts with target machine type 'x64' [T:\src\github\tensorflow\cmake_build\proto_text.vcxproj]
    41>png\install\lib\libpng12_static.lib : warning LNK4272: library machine type 'X86' conflicts with target machine type 'x64' [T:\src\github\tensorflow\cmake_build\proto_text.vcxproj]
    41>jpeg\install\lib\libjpeg.lib : warning LNK4272: library machine type 'X86' conflicts with target machine type 'x64' [T:\src\github\tensorflow\cmake_build\proto_text.vcxproj]
    41>lmdb\install\lib\lmdb.lib : warning LNK4272: library machine type 'X86' conflicts with target machine type 'x64' [T:\src\github\tensorflow\cmake_build\proto_text.vcxproj]
    41>jsoncpp\src\jsoncpp\src\lib_json\Release\jsoncpp.lib : warning LNK4272: library machine type 'X86' conflicts with target machine type 'x64' [T:\src\github\tensorflow\cmake_build\proto_text.vcxproj]
    41>farmhash\install\lib\farmhash.lib : warning LNK4272: library machine type 'X86' conflicts with target machine type 'x64' [T:\src\github\tensorflow\cmake_build\proto_text.vcxproj]
    41>fft2d\\src\lib\fft2d.lib : warning LNK4272: library machine type 'X86' conflicts with target machine type 'x64' [T:\src\github\tensorflow\cmake_build\proto_text.vcxproj]
    41>highwayhash\install\lib\highwayhash.lib : warning LNK4272: library machine type 'X86' conflicts with target machine type 'x64' [T:\src\github\tensorflow\cmake_build\proto_text.vcxproj]
    41>nsync\install\lib\nsync.lib : warning LNK4272: library machine type 'X86' conflicts with target machine type 'x64' [T:\src\github\tensorflow\cmake_build\proto_text.vcxproj]

...so for some reason it looks like the build is defaulting to making 32-bit builds for some of the external projects. I guess the spirit of the 90s is alive in CMake.

Notably protobuf.cmake doesn't display these errors, as it has an explicit directive to set the build platform to ${CMAKE_GENERATOR_PLATFORM} inprotobuf.cmake:

tensorflow/tensorflow/contrib/cmake/external/protobuf.cmake

Lines 38 to 49 in 926fc13

# This section is to make sure CONFIGURE_COMMAND use the same generator settings
set(PROTOBUF_GENERATOR_PLATFORM)
if (CMAKE_GENERATOR_PLATFORM)
set(PROTOBUF_GENERATOR_PLATFORM -A ${CMAKE_GENERATOR_PLATFORM})
endif()
set(PROTOBUF_GENERATOR_TOOLSET)
if (CMAKE_GENERATOR_TOOLSET)
set(PROTOBUF_GENERATOR_TOOLSET -T ${CMAKE_GENERATOR_TOOLSET})
endif()
set(PROTOBUF_ADDITIONAL_CMAKE_OPTIONS -Dprotobuf_MSVC_STATIC_RUNTIME:BOOL=OFF
-G${CMAKE_GENERATOR} ${PROTOBUF_GENERATOR_PLATFORM} ${PROTOBUF_GENERATOR_TOOLSET})
# End of section

...so perhaps what's needed is to replicate that structure (effectively setting the -A, -G, and -T flags to match the parent) in each of the externals. Perhaps setting one but not the others leads to it using bad defaults?

    41>nsync\install\lib\nsync.lib : warning LNK4272: library machine type 'X86' conflicts with target machine type 'x64' [T:\src\github\tensorflow\cmake_build\proto_text.vcxproj]

...so for some reason it looks like the build is defaulting to making 32-bit builds for some of the external projects. I guess the spirit of the 90s is alive in CMake.
Notably protobuf.cmake doesn't display these errors, as it has an explicit directive to set the build platform to ${CMAKE_GENERATOR_PLATFORM} inprotobuf.cmake:

  
    
      tensorflow/tensorflow/contrib/cmake/external/protobuf.cmake
    
    
        Lines 38 to 49
      in
      926fc13
    
    
    
    

        
          
           # This section is to make sure CONFIGURE_COMMAND use the same generator settings 
        

        
          
           set(PROTOBUF_GENERATOR_PLATFORM) 
        

        
          
           if (CMAKE_GENERATOR_PLATFORM) 
        

        
          
             set(PROTOBUF_GENERATOR_PLATFORM -A ${CMAKE_GENERATOR_PLATFORM}) 
        

        
          
           endif() 
        

        
          
           set(PROTOBUF_GENERATOR_TOOLSET) 
        

        
          
           if (CMAKE_GENERATOR_TOOLSET) 
        

        
          
           set(PROTOBUF_GENERATOR_TOOLSET -T ${CMAKE_GENERATOR_TOOLSET}) 
        

        
          
           endif()

             -G${CMAKE_GENERATOR} ${PROTOBUF_GENERATOR_PLATFORM} ${PROTOBUF_GENERATOR_TOOLSET}) 
        

        
          
           # End of section 
        
    
  


...so perhaps what's needed is to replicate that structure (effectively setting the -A, -G, and -T flags to match the parent) in each of the externals. Perhaps setting one but not the others leads to it using bad defaults?
body:
I grepped the logs and there are some suspicious architecture-related warnings:

```
$ grep "library machine type" 5ea42dd3-build.log  | head
    41>zlib\install\lib\zlibstatic.lib : warning LNK4272: library machine type 'X86' conflicts with target machine type 'x64' [T:\src\github\tensorflow\cmake_build\proto_text.vcxproj]
    41>gif\install\lib\giflib.lib : warning LNK4272: library machine type 'X86' conflicts with target machine type 'x64' [T:\src\github\tensorflow\cmake_build\proto_text.vcxproj]
    41>png\install\lib\libpng12_static.lib : warning LNK4272: library machine type 'X86' conflicts with target machine type 'x64' [T:\src\github\tensorflow\cmake_build\proto_text.vcxproj]
    41>jpeg\install\lib\libjpeg.lib : warning LNK4272: library machine type 'X86' conflicts with target machine type 'x64' [T:\src\github\tensorflow\cmake_build\proto_text.vcxproj]
    41>lmdb\install\lib\lmdb.lib : warning LNK4272: library machine type 'X86' conflicts with target machine type 'x64' [T:\src\github\tensorflow\cmake_build\proto_text.vcxproj]
    41>jsoncpp\src\jsoncpp\src\lib_json\Release\jsoncpp.lib : warning LNK4272: library machine type 'X86' conflicts with target machine type 'x64' [T:\src\github\tensorflow\cmake_build\proto_text.vcxproj]
    41>farmhash\install\lib\farmhash.lib : warning LNK4272: library machine type 'X86' conflicts with target machine type 'x64' [T:\src\github\tensorflow\cmake_build\proto_text.vcxproj]
    41>fft2d\\src\lib\fft2d.lib : warning LNK4272: library machine type 'X86' conflicts with target machine type 'x64' [T:\src\github\tensorflow\cmake_build\proto_text.vcxproj]
    41>highwayhash\install\lib\highwayhash.lib : warning LNK4272: library machine type 'X86' conflicts with target machine type 'x64' [T:\src\github\tensorflow\cmake_build\proto_text.vcxproj]
    41>nsync\install\lib\nsync.lib : warning LNK4272: library machine type 'X86' conflicts with target machine type 'x64' [T:\src\github\tensorflow\cmake_build\proto_text.vcxproj]
```

...so for some reason it looks like the build is defaulting to making 32-bit builds for some of the external projects. I guess the spirit of the 90s is alive in CMake.

Notably `protobuf.cmake` doesn't display these errors, as it has an explicit directive to set the build platform to `${CMAKE_GENERATOR_PLATFORM}` in`protobuf.cmake`:

https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/926fc13f7378d14fa7980963c4fe774e5922e336/tensorflow/contrib/cmake/external/protobuf.cmake#L38-L49

...so perhaps what's needed is to replicate *that* structure (effectively setting the `-A`, `-G`, and `-T` flags to match the parent) in each of the externals. Perhaps setting one but not the others leads to it using bad defaults?
